intro: Cunila coccinea, commonly known as scarlet tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in moist, disturbed soils in wetlands and along stream banks. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies. Cunila coccinea is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
